title: FF! Doc | IsUserInRolePipe
paragraphs: If the role is not specified by the role attribute, the input of the pipe is used as the role.
N.B. The role itself must be specified by hand in the deployment descriptors web.xml and application.xml.
listItems: Required Support a current transaction; create a new one if none exists.
Supports Support a current transaction; execute non-transactionally if none exists.
Mandatory Support a current transaction; throw an exception if no current transaction exists.
RequiresNew Create a new transaction, suspending the current transaction if one exists.
NotSupported Do not support a current transaction; rather always execute non-transactionally.
Never Do not support a current transaction; throw an exception if a current transaction exists.

IsUserInRolePipe
AdvancedPipesRouter
Pipe that checks if the calling user has a specified role. Uses the PipeLineSessions methods.

If the role is not specified by the role attribute, the input of the pipe is used as the role.

N.B. The role itself must be specified by hand in the deployment descriptors web.xml and application.xml.

See also
Github - IsUserInRolePipe Implementation Examples
Javadoc - org.frankframework.pipes.IsUserInRolePipe
Syntax
Copy
<IsUserInRolePipe name=""/>
Attributes
Required
ATTRIBUTE NAME & DESCRIPTION	TYPE	DEFAULT
name	text	-
The functional name of this pipe. It can be referenced by the path attribute of a PipeForward.
Optional
ATTRIBUTE NAME & DESCRIPTION	TYPE	DEFAULT
role	text	-
The J2EE role(s) to check. If the user is in multiple roles, the first specified role
